lines.text: Is your name Jewel?
No.
The hotel register....
My name is
[d'Estaing writes his name on a blackboard]
Jewels...Gasperd...Die-es-ting
Jules...soft j, silent s...Gaspard...silent d...d'Estaing...just a touch of dipthong.
[Confronted by Crane.]
I'll tell you what I am... and what you are. I'm a man with a gun, and you're drunk.
You got him in the arm
I aimed for his Reb heart.
Your performance is never up to your intentions.
I've got a half dollar that says he's a skinny runt tied to a big gun. You know, them skinny ones is the ones that get handy with a gun. They got to, you know.

That's my mother's grave out there, Ruth. I planted them vines on the porch. I'll live here until I die...sooner or later. However, as long as I live, I'll fight the whole town for the right to die here.
I heard shots. They woke me.
Just a little gunplay at the saloon. Nobody hurt.
Gunplay? Guns is a plaything to you?
Play and work, Mrs. Adams. Work and play.
I've killed so many men in the last four years, one more don't matter none. Tell me...you pass up your chance, why should I pass up mine?
Truce for the night.
Oh...oh, and you believe when they say I'm crazy?
So am I. You know it's a funny thing...a man crazy to live takes a chance and dies; a man who doesn't care takes the same chance and gets away with it. That's called Jules Gaspard's Law.
I'm still not standing between you and something you want?
You're standing between me and the road out of town.
